intro: Schlimia trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed pincushion, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, spherical flower heads. It is native to South America and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Schlimia trifida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance. Its botanical structure supports its adaptation to harsh climates, making it a resilient and visually striking species.
